docs.snippet: 9 P.M. (HBO) THE RECRUITER  As it strives to maintain troop levels in Iraq and Afghanistan, the United States Army is encountering a dramatic recruiting crisis. This documentary by Edet Belzberg follows the fervently patriotic Sgt. First Class Clay...
docs.lead_paragraph: 9 P.M. (HBO) THE RECRUITER As it strives to maintain troop levels in Iraq and Afghanistan, the United States Army is encountering a dramatic recruiting crisis. This documentary by Edet Belzberg follows the fervently patriotic Sgt. First Class Clay Usie as he works closely with four recruits in Houma, La., a small Cajun town of shrimpers and oil riggers near New Orleans, finishing their senior year of high school and preparing for basic training. Lauren, above, a 17-year-old from a poor background, sees the military as the best way to pay for college and become an artist. Bobby, 18, an honor student with a bright future, decides to join the Army despite the disapproval of his father, a veteran. ''He's made the decision,'' his father says. ''I don't know that any 18-year-old can really understand that the end of his life could be around the corner in Iraq.'' 7 A.M. (NBC) TODAY House Speaker Nancy Pelosi talks about her book, ''Know Your Power,'' and again on ''The View,'' at 11 on ABC.
